title: This Is How The PSL Spot-Fixing Scandal Has Shaken The Very Core Of Pakistan Cricket - Indiatimes.com
text:
February 19, 2017 
The Pakistan Super League spot-fixing scandal has once again brought the game into disrepute. 
The PCB now is trying to do damage control as they try to flush out those responsible. 
AFP 
So what exactly do we know so far about the problem? 
Let's find out: 1. Sharjeel Khan and Khalid Latif sent home from the league 
AFP 
The two of them were suspended and sent home for their alleged involvement in spot-fixing. It is alleged they accepted money to under-perform at certain points in their respective matches. 2. Rameez Raja laments the Pakistan has not learnt its lesson 
AFP 
The former skipper felt that the likes of Mohammad Amir should not have been allowed back in international cricket and that is why the spot-fixing issue has returned to haunt Pakistan cricket. 3. Nasir Jamshed arrested along with bookie 
AFP 
It is believed that he had accepted money to fail in a game during the league . He has been let out on bail but is still under investigation. 4. Sharjeel and Latif charge-sheeted 
AFP 
The PCB have given them 14 days to respond to the allegations and they cannot take part in matches until the matter is resolved. 5. Shoaib Akhtar feels more embarrassment will follow 
AFP
